main event: A yellow-white flickering light was observed in the south that disappeared over the horizon after about 25 minutes.
interesting points: The object was brighter than the stars.
The object remained stationary for an extended period before suddenly moving off rapidly at high speed in a straight line.
The sighting was detected by a very sensitive radar installation under the operational control of the U.S. Air Force.
The observer was outdoors when the sighting occurred.
There were no photographs or physical evidence associated with the sighting.
